title.value: A Diffusion-Model of Joint Interactive Navigation
title.justification: It is the title of the research paper.
title.quote: A Diffusion-Model of Joint Interactive Navigation

description: This paper presents DJINN, a diffusion model for generating joint traffic scenarios with flexible conditioning based on agent states. Evaluation on popular trajectory forecasting datasets shows state-of-the-art performance for joint trajectory metrics and demonstrates the model's ability to perform goal-based sampling, behavior-class sampling, and scenario editing.

type.justification: The paper involves the evaluation of the DJINN model on popular trajectory forecasting datasets, reporting metrics such as minADE and minFDE, along with comparisons to other models.
type.quote: On popular trajectory forecasting datasets, we report state of the art performance on joint trajectory metrics.

primary_research_field.justification: The paper introduces DJINN, a diffusion-based method for generating traffic scenarios, which is a topic within the broader field of Deep Learning.
primary_research_field.quote: In this paper, we present DJINN â€“ a diffusion based method of generating traffic scenarios.

sub_research_fields.justification: The paper focuses on the development and application of a diffusion model for generating joint traffic scenarios, fitting within the subfield of Generative Models.
sub_research_fields.quote: DJINN is a diffusion model over the joint states of all agents in the scene.

name.justification: DJINN is the main model proposed and contributed by the paper.
name.quote: we propose DJINN, a model which generatively produces joint traffic scenarios with flexible conditioning.

caracteristics.justification: The paper clearly states that DJINN is a diffusion model for generating traffic scenarios.
caracteristics.quote: DJINN is a diffusion model over the joint states of all agents in the scene.

name.justification: Scene Transformer is used for comparison with DJINN in joint motion forecasting tasks.
name.quote: We further analyze the joint motion forecasting performance of DJINN. We compare DJINN against a reproduction of Scene Transformer trained for joint motion forecasting, using their reported hyperparameters.

caracteristics.justification: Scene Transformer uses a transformer network for jointly producing trajectory sets for all agents.
caracteristics.quote: Scene Transformer [30], which uses a similar backbone architecture to our method, uses a transformer [48] network to jointly produce trajectory sets for all agents in the scene.

name.justification: The paper benchmarks its model using the Argoverse dataset for ego-only and joint motion forecasting metrics.
name.quote: We evaluate the quality of sampled trajectories with both joint and ego-only motion forecasting on the Argoverse [4] and INTERACTION [53] datasets.

name.justification: The paper uses the INTERACTION dataset alongside Argoverse for model evaluation.
name.quote: We evaluate the quality of sampled trajectories with both joint and ego-only motion forecasting on the Argoverse [4] and INTERACTION [53] datasets.
